backgroundInformationList.description: Surplus Ad - 4050 Yonge St  25 Audley Av

noticeDescription:
NOTICE is hereby given that in accordance with the City of Toronto’s real estate disposal by-law, the following properties were declared surplus:

 

1.         On May 31, 2022, a City-owned parcel of land being a part of 4050 Yonge Street and legally described as Part of Lots 99, 100, 101 & 102, Plan 204, designated as Parts 1 & 2 on Plan 66R-26058; City Of Toronto, was declared surplus.  The City proposes to invite an offer to purchase from Yonge City Square Inc., the adjacent property owner; subject to the reservation of an easement in favor of the City to allow for public access from the existing Toronto Transit Commission ("TTC") entrance connections to the below-grade York Mills subway station.

 

2.         On July 16, 2019, a property to be transferred to the City as a parkland dedication, being a part of 25 Audley Street and legally described as Part of Lot 247, Plan M68, designated as Parts 4, 5, and 6 on Plan 66R-30597, was declared surplus effective as of the date that the City acquires ownership of the property. The City proposes to enter into a land exchange agreement with the owner of 1 Audley Street in respect of the conveyance of the property in exchange for Parts 10 and 11 on Plan 66R-30597 for park purposes.

 

The following City official has information about the proposed dispositions: Mr. Joseph Sergnese, Joseph.Sergnese@toronto.ca Tel: 416-392-1857, Metro Hall, 55 John Street, 2nd Floor, Toronto, Ontario M5V 3C6. Enquiries may be made of the said official until August 5th, 2022.
title: Declaration of Surplus Property
